titleStmt.title: J. W. Proctor to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1859

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Stanford April 2, 1864
Hon T. E. Bramlette
Governor of Ky.
Dear Sir
At a meeting of the Board of Trustees of the town of Stanford, held April 1st 1864, the following resolution was passed.
That Mr. Joseph Severance be recommended to the Governor for appointment as Police Judge of the town of Stanford in the place of Jno. S. Murphy, resigned."
If in accordance with your wishes, will you commission Said Joseph Severance as Police Judge till the next general election?

Enclosed we send the resig-
nation of the former Judge

Very Respectfully
J. W Proctor Trust
B. T.
C Barnes Clk.

Lincoln Co
Police Judge
Jos Severance
Appt
9th May/64
Resignation accepted & Coms ordered as requested
